Literature Review: Odd viscosity and odd elasticity are intriguing phenomena that challenge our understanding of traditional notions of elasticity and viscosity in materials science. From a continuum perspective, these materials exhibit additional linear response coefficients that deviate from the conventional elastic and viscous behavior. This review aims to provide an overview of the rich phenomenology of odd viscosity and odd elasticity, including transverse responses, modified dislocation dynamics, and topological waves, as well as systems that display these properties. We will also discuss the microscopic mechanisms that give rise to these phenomena and explore the implications for our understanding of fluid and solid behavior in nonequilibrium systems.
